page.title: 16The Miners Strike in Aston
page.content: The nation-wide miners strike which lasted a year and ended in March l985 was about pits closing down in the area. It caused a lot of hardship because the families of striking miners became very poor as they didn't have any money to buy clothes and food. When the children of working miners went to school striking miners' children fell out with them and the families got very angry with each other. Then it was the Police's turn to be in trouble. They arrested pickets and I think they caused a lot of trouble as well, because if the pickets got out of hand and started to riot they came and hit them with sticks and the situation became worse. Some of the men have been in jail for the first time and now have a criminal record. Special feeding arrangements were made for families of strikers.
